alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 20 at 4:31PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Porcupine River from the border to Fort Yukon * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying locations along the Porcupine River. Residents at Fort Yukon report that minor flooding is occuring near the Porcupine River with one home cutoff by water. Additionally, minor flooding is occuring in low lying areas of Fort Yukon near the airport with water surrounding the runway. Water is rising slowly there. If water continues to rise it could impact the runway at Fort Yukon. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Warming temperatures are causing rapid snowmelt in the Eastern Brooks Range and sending a large volume of water into the Porcupine River. Warm temperatures continuing over the weekend will likely increase the snowmelt, and cause the already high water on the Porcupine River to rise slowly this weekend. Should the water continue to rise at Fort Yukon moderate flooding is possible and the airport could be impacted, but this is uncertain at this time. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood - If you live near or along the Porcupine River move valuables to higher ground, and prepare to move yourself to higher ground at short notice.
info.instruction: You should monitor water levels and prepare flooding to get worse. Those living in areas prone to flooding should take action now and move valuables to higher ground.
